page.title: 19LANDSCAPE
page.content: Despite much new building the landscape still retains a rural look, the housing being mainly on the western slope of the valley and not encroaching too much on the higher slopes.Many of the older buildings being isolated on the hillsides. The hamlet of{Onesacre}consists of a group of ancient stone buildings namely,{Tophill}Farm,listed and built in 1580,a large farmhouse,two listed cruck barns, {Low Fold}farmhouse a 17th. century building,{The Old School {House,}part of which dates to 1100,{Coldwell Farm,}1853,and a few cottages.In addition there are many 19th. century stone cottages on Church St.and close to the village centre. Fields and small wooded areas dominate the western slopes of the Don,the eastern slope being chiefly managed conifer woodland.
